IItem

BaseDirectory(int, string?)

Sets Id to id, Name to adjusted path and ModifiedDate to Now.

public BaseDirectory(int id, string? path)

Parameters

id int

This item identification number.

path string

Path to the directory (file) that you want to associate with this object.

Remarks

If path is a valid path to directory (file), Name is set to path to this directory (file), that uses '/' as directory separator character. Otherwise Name is set to null.

BaseDirectory(int, string?, DateTime)

Sets all properties to values of appropriate arguments.

public BaseDirectory(int id, string? path, DateTime modifiedDate)

Parameters

id int

Identification number of item.

path string

Valid path to directory/file associated with this item. Path should use '/' as directory separator.

modifiedDate DateTime

Date and time of last modification of this entity.

Remarks

No evaluation or adjusting is performed, so use this method only for already evaluated and prepared data, for example from database.

IComparable<T>
IDirectory
IItem

Methods

CompareTo(IDirectory?)

Compares paths ( Name) of the current instance and another BaseDirectory object and returns integer indicating whether current instance precedes, follows or occurs in the same position in sort order as other object.

public int CompareTo(IDirectory? other)

Parameters

other IDirectory

An object to compare with this instance.

Returns

int

A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings:

Value Meaning
Less than zero This instance precedes other in the sort order.
Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as other.
Greater than zero This instance follows other in the sort order.

Remarks

After cutting off common part of both paths (common base directory), in sort order first occurs object without subdirectories. If both shortened paths (don't)have subdirectories they are sorted by names of the leased nested, not common, directory (file without extension) in almost lexical order. The difference is, that if both names are the same, except for the numerical postfixes, they are ordered numerically by values of this postfixes.

See Also
BaseItem

GetPath()

Gets directory/file path held in Name property.

public virtual string? GetPath()

Returns

string

System specific valid path of this item.

See Also
BaseItem
IComparable<T>
IDirectory
IItem

SetPath(string?)

Sets Name as adjusted path.

public virtual bool SetPath(string? path)

Parameters

path string

Valid absolute or relative path, that you want this directory(file) to have.

Returns

bool
  • true if Name was successfully set.
  • false if Name was set to null

Remarks

Checks if given path is valid (doesn't contain any invalid path characters). If it is valid, sets Name as given path using '/' as directory separator character. Otherwise it sets Name to null.
